title: Automated Federated Learning in Mobile Edge Networks -- Fast Adaptation and Convergence. (arXiv:2303.12999v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Federated Learning (FL) can be used in mobile edge networks to train machine learning models in a distributed manner. Recently, FL has been interpreted within a Model-Agnostic Meta-Learning (MAML) framework, which brings FL significant advantages in fast adaptation and convergence over heterogeneous datasets. However, existing research simply combines MAML and FL without explicitly addressing how much benefit MAML brings to FL and how to maximize such benefit over mobile edge networks. In this paper, we quantify the benefit from two aspects: optimizing FL hyperparameters (i.e., sampled data size and the number of communication rounds) and resource allocation (i.e., transmit power) in mobile edge networks. Specifically, we formulate the MAML-based FL design as an overall learning time minimization problem, under the constraints of model accuracy and energy consumption. translated_title: 移动边缘网络中的自动联邦学习——快速适应和收敛
translated_abstract: 联邦学习（FL）可以在移动边缘网络中用于分布式训练机器学习模型。最近，FL在模型无关元学习（MAML）框架中得到解释，这为FL带来了快速适应和收敛于异构数据集上的显着优势。然而，现有研究仅仅将MAML和FL结合起来，没有明确说明MAML给FL带来多少好处以及如何在移动边缘网络中最大化这种好处。
tldr: 本文使用基于MAML的FL设计来最小化整体学习时间，优化FL超参数（例如采样数据大小和通信轮数）和资源分配（例如发送功率），同时考虑模型精度和能量消耗的限制。
en_tdlr: This paper quantifies the benefits of combining Model-Agnostic Meta-Learning (MAML) and Federated Learning (FL) in mobile edge networks by minimizing overall learning time through optimizing FL hyperparameters (such as sampled data size and the number of communication rounds) and resource allocation (such as transmit power), while considering model accuracy and energy consumption constraints.
